intro: Wagatea spicata, commonly known as the spicate wagatea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Wagatea spicata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
